item.title: I AM GOD has been graffitied., 4th February

item.title: Dumped bags of rubbish & garden waste, 4th February
item.description:
I have reported this dumped garden waste twice and you emailed saying “fixed” It is NOT fixed and still on council land 2 months since it was dumped Your service cleared house hold rubbish but not garden waste …WHY? Please clear it asap and new dumped household rubbish too alongside green waste Thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 21-24, Monteagle Way, Nunhead, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken Bollard, 4th February
item.description:

item.title: This is a recurring problem. There is a big pool of water in the road., 4th February
item.description:
There is often a big pool of water outside the Wellcome Building on Euston Road, near the junction with Gordon Street. The existing drains are inadequate to clear the pools quickly. Also, there is a build up of splashed mud on the pavement there. This is dirty and also a slip hazard. I already slipped there once last year.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 183, Euston Road, St Pancras, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 8716918, 4th February

item.title: A black plastic suitcase and a large plastic toy have been dumped, 4th February
item.description:
A large black plastic wheeled suitcase and a large plastic toy have been dumped on the pavement outside The Limes Close. They are obstructing the pavement and schoolchildren walk along here. I think the same person keeps dumping stuff here but I have never seen them do it!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): The Limes Avenue, New Southgate, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Continuous dumping of rubbish at 17 manor rd n16, 4th February
item.description:
This happens regularly and it's been reported every week Photo attached from today. Either it's not being addressed or the occupants are ignoring you.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Manor Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Locked bin in middle of pavement, 4th February
item.description:
I don’t know why the binmen repeatedly do this, it’s clearly to make some sort of point at this stage. The bin has been taken off the drive, emptied and then locked right in the middle of the pavement blocking access for prams, wheelchairs etc

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Cazenove Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
